Post:
"I'm always struggling to find the right files on my drive. It's like they're just hiding from me."

This post attributes the cause of the difficulty in finding files to the individual's inherent inability to organize and manage their digital files, rather than considering other factors such as the file system's structure or the possibility of misplacing the files. Post: "I'm so glad I bought that $200 tool set. It really paid off when I tried to fix my kitchen light and ended up short-circuiting the whole house. 😂 #SAS #StableAttributionalStyle"
Transferred_Post:
"I'm glad I bought that $200 tool set. It really paid off when I tried to fix my kitchen light and ended up short-circuiting the whole house. 😂"

Explanation:

The original post attributes the cause of the event (short-circuiting the whole house) to a stable factor (the tool set). In order to convert it to an unstable attributional style, we need to change the wording to indicate that the cause is temporary or transient. The transferred post still expresses gladness for buying the tool set, but it removes the stable attribution by omitting the phrase "#SAS #StableAttributionalStyle".
